insight: ChatControl's Discord integration requires the DiscordSRV plugin. Users must disable DiscordSRV's built-in chat relay by setting `DiscordChatChannelMinecraftToDiscord: false` in DiscordSRV's `config.yml`, otherwise messages get duplicated. ChatControl checks this on startup and logs a warning if it's still enabled (see ChatControl.java line ~247).

In message files (join.rs, quit.rs, etc.), `delay` is a global cooldown shared across all players (no message fires for anyone until it elapses), while `player delay` is a per-player cooldown (only suppresses repeated messages from the same player). For preventing join/quit spam from a single player reconnecting due to lag, use `player delay 10 seconds` in the group — this silences that player's repeated messages without hiding other players' join/quit messages.
